void GrMesh::GetRangePlane ( MVec3 &  normal,
MVec3 &  point,
unsigned int  range 
) const

get the vertices.

get the indices.

this should be impossible.

figure out the normal.

if non-zero length, compute the plane and return.

all done.

next triangle.

this should be impossible.

calculate the plane.

figure out the normal.

if non-zero length, compute the plane and return.

all done.

next triangle.

no triangles with any area! This isn't really killer... just kinda... shitty.

Definition at line 142 of file GrMesh.h.

void GrMesh::Load ( UReader &  reader,
const UFastArray< URef< GrSkin > > &  skins 
)

clean up...

read the name.

read in the VBO enable flag.

read the range information.

read in each range.

load the AO map.

read in the bounds.

read in the vertex and index counts.

read in the component flags and create our vertex buffer.

note that we do the & GR_VERTEX_ALL to remove any unsupported components. Unique UVs have been removed from the engine, and this keeps old data loading.

read the vertex data.

read indices

get the skin.

read in the best fitting box.

read the bounding sphere.

Definition at line 775 of file GrMesh.cpp.

void GrMesh::Pick ( TriHitArray &  triHits,
const MRay &  ray 
) const

picks the closest triangle from the mesh and returns the ID of triangle, the model space position where the hit occured, as well as the bary-centric coordinates of the triangle intersection. Returns ~0 if no intersection was found.

TODO: OPTIMIZE THIS. We might want to cache face normals/plane equations for each triangle! Note that we can cache the dominant axis too... this way we can eliminate the code in the inner loop that does this!

perform a check on each range to see if we need to test the triangles for intersection.

if we intersect with the AABox in the range...

perform ray-triangle intersections with each triangle in the range.

check to see if we're indexed or not.

get the indices.

go through all of the triangles in the range. Note that we're going through vertices.

get the vertices of the triangle.

go through all of the triangles in the range. Note that we're going through vertices.

get the vertices of the triangle.

Definition at line 865 of file GrMesh.cpp.

void GrMesh::SetSkin ( URef< GrSkin >  skin  ) 

skin info. Note that the mesh takes ownership over the skinning data passed in. Also note that once the skin is set, it cannot be changed.

the skin can only be set once! Once it's set, it cannot be changed!
